channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jeff Bezos Defends Decision to End Washington Post Endorsements
item.description: Mr. Bezos, the newspaper’s owner, said that presidential endorsements “create a perception of bias” and that “my views here are, in fact, principled.”

item.title: Starbucks threatens to fire staff who don’t come back to office
item.description: CEO Brian Niccol’s own work arrangement allows him to live in California and travel 1,000 miles to Seattle on the company’s corporate jet.

item.title: Douglas Elliman Realty president fired days after CEO stepped down
item.description: Their departures from the brokerage and its parent company are effective immediately.

item.title: An ultra-rare 1975 dime stashed away for decades just surfaced—and sold for a whopping $500,000
item.description: The coin depicts President Franklin D. Roosevelt and is one of just two known to exist without its distinctive “S” mint mark.

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Resume, Overshadowed by U.S. Election
item.description: Envoys from Israel, Egypt, the United States and Qatar took part in the negotiations, but no agreements are expected until American voters choose thei...

item.title: ‘Direct attack on Democracy’: Hundreds of ballots have been destroyed in drop box fire attacks in Oregon and Washington
item.description: In Phoenix last week, officials said roughly five ballots were destroyed and others damaged when a fire was set in a drop box at a U.S. Postal Service...

item.title: Job scams are climbing. Experts say to watch out for these red flags
item.description: If you’re a job seeker, here are some recommendations from experts on how to avoid job scammers:

item.title: Live Updates: Israel’s Parliament Passes Bill That Threatens Work of U.N. Agency for Palestinians
item.description: The Knesset opened its winter session and approved legislation that banned the agency known as UNRWA from operating in Israel. Prime Minister Benjamin...

item.title: Tommy Robinson, U.K. Anti-immigrant Agitator, Jailed for Contempt of Court
item.description: The founder of the English Defence League was sentenced to 18 months for ignoring a court order to stop making false claims about a teenage Syrian ref...

item.title: A Caller Told 911 a Bear Had Chased Him Off a Cliff. The Police Say It Was Murder.
item.description: The sheriff in a rural Tennessee county said his office is searching for a man who used a stolen identity to pose as a victim.

item.title: MAGA Unchained in Madison Square Garden
item.description: Trump’s big rally featured unadulterated racism and more talk of “enemies from within.”

item.title: Anita Hill: Kamala Harris and the Power of Dignity
item.description: The insults hurled at Ms. Harris are a reminder of how Republican senators tried to shame me when I challenged Clarence Thomas’s fitness.

item.title: Trump Long Ago Crossed the Line From Propriety to Profanity. Then Came the Garden.
item.description: In former President Donald J. Trump’s third campaign for the White House, his speeches have grown coarser and coarser.

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Resume, Overshadowed by U.S. Election
item.description: Envoys from Israel, Egypt, the United States and Qatar took part in the negotiations, but no agreements are expected until American voters choose thei...

item.title: Iran Executes Jamshid Sharmahd, German-Iranian Opponent Who Lived in U.S.
item.description: Jamshid Sharmahd had been accused of helping in a deadly terrorist bombing in 2008. Another Iranian prisoner, the Nobel laureate Narges Mohammadi, is ...
